data.label: Animal
data.definition: Any attribute of a particular animal or a definied group of animals individuals

data.label: Caste
data.definition: The society division that is specialized in the function it performs and is distinguished by anatomical or morphological features from other individuals of in the society
data.comments: Recommended best pratices is to use a controlled vocabulary

data.label: Plant
data.definition: Any attribute of a particular plant or a defined group of plants inviduals

data.label: Anther Dehiscence Type
data.definition: The physical mechanism of anther dehiscence (release of the pollen grains)
data.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary

data.label: Flower Abundance
data.definition: The number of open flowers or inflorescences on the plant
data.comments: If it is an estimate then you should describe the accuracy of the measurement using http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/measurementAccuracy

data.label: Floral Symmetry
data.definition: The symmetry describing whether, and how, a flower, in particular its perianth, can be divided into two or more identical or mirror-image parts.
data.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Phenotype and Trait Ontology

data.label: Floral System
data.definition: The system by which bisexual flowers optimize their reproductive success, through mechanisms that promote self- or cross-pollination
data.comments:
It can be a morphological, temporal or movement-based mechanism.
Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

data.label: Plant Habit
data.definition: The general appearance, characteristic form, or mode of growth of the plant

data.label: Human Use
data.definition: Ways in which species are utilized by people, including cultural use
data.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

data.label: Mating System
data.definition: A list (concatenated and separated) of the modes of gene transfer from one generation to the next through sexual reproduction
data.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ) and to use a controlled vocabulary.

data.label: Self Incompatibility Type
data.definition: The type or class of self-incompatibility system of the plant species
data.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. If the plant has no self-incompatibility system use the value `absent`.

data.label: Apomitic System Embryo Origin
data.definition: The general mode of apomixis embryo origin of a plant
data.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

data.label: Apomitic System Fertilization
data.definition: The general mode of apomixis endosperm development of a plant
data.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

data.label: Apomitic System Reproduction
data.definition: The general mode of apomixis reproduction of a plant
data.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

data.label: Sexual System
data.definition: The distribution of floral types within and among the individuals of the same population
data.comments: The gender expression is based in the presence and distribution of fertile whorls within the flower. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary

data.label: Flower
data.definition: Any attribute of a particular flower or a definied group of flowers
data.examples: The shape and the number of anther of a flower

data.label: Anther Pollen Grains Quantity
data.definition: The total number of pollen grains in the anther(s) of a flower
data.comments: For flowers with multiple anthers the number provided should be the sum of pollen grains in all anthers

data.label: Stigmatic Area In Square Milimiters
data.definition: The total surface area in square millimeters of the stigma of a flower

data.label: Style Length In Milimiters
data.definition: The length in milimiters from the base to the tip of the style of a flower

data.label: Colored Flower Structure
data.definition: The predominant colored structure(s) of the flower(s)
data.comments:
Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

data.label: Flower Color
data.definition: The predominant color(s) of the flower(s)
data.comments:
Recommended best practice is to separate the values with space vertical bar space ( | ).

Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

data.label: Flower Shape
data.definition: The overall shape of the flowers
data.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

data.label: Flower Orientation
data.definition: The orientation (presentation) of the flower with respect to the flower or inflorescence main axis
data.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

data.label: Flower Opening Type
data.definition: The type of flower describing whether the flower's corolla opens or not, exposing its reproductive parts
data.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

data.label: Floral Attractants
data.definition: Types of attractants (visual, chemical or tactile) present in the flowers that floral visitors may use to locate them and their resources
data.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ) and to use a controlled vocabulary

data.label: Ovule Quantity
data.definition: The total amount of ovules in a flower

data.label: Flower Longevity
data.definition: The total amount of hours comprising the time between flower opening and flower senescence
data.comments: A flower is considered opened when its petals are fully open regardless of anther maturation and stigma receptivity, and flower senescence is when floral parts begin to wilt and fall off or the ovary starts to develop into fruit

data.label: Flower Opening Period
data.definition: The time or interval during which a chasmogamous flower opens exposing its reproductive parts
data.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a time interval that conforms to ISO  8601-1:2019.

data.label: Functional Flower Lifespan In Hours
data.definition: The total amount of hours during which a flower is sexually functional
data.comments: The period of time when stigma is receptive to the germination of pollen grains, ovules are receptive to the pollen tubes or anthers present viable pollen grains

data.label: Interaction
data.definition: An interaction event that occurs at some location during some time.
data.examples: A bee visits a flower of a plant

data.label: Visited Flower Sex
data.definition: The sex of the visited flower
data.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary

data.label: Animal Place Of Contact
data.definition: A list (concatenated and separated) of the animal body parts that contact the plant during the interaction
data.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( `|` ) and to use a controlled vocabulary

data.label: Nectar Collecting Body Part
data.definition: The animal body part used to collect nectar from the plant nectaries
data.comments: The plant nectaries can be floral or extrafloral nectaries. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as Uberon or the Hymenoptera Anatomy Ontology

data.label: Nectar Collecting Body Part Length In Milimiters
data.definition: The length in millimeters of the body part used to collect nectar from the plant nectaries
data.comments: If reporting this value, the `nectarCollectingBodyPart` should also be provided.

data.label: Flower Place Of Contact
data.definition: A list (concatenated and separated) of flower parts touched by the animal during the interaction
data.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( `|` ) and to use a controlled vocabulary

data.label: Resource Collected
data.definition: A list (concatenated and separated) of floral resources used or removed from the visited flower(s) during the interaction
data.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( `|` ) and to use a controlled vocabulary

data.label: Visited Flowers Quantity
data.definition: The total number of flowers visited during the interaction

data.label: Reproductive Success
data.definition: A reproductive success measurement as a result or a effect of the interaction(s) on the subject or object of the interaction
data.comments: An outcome is related to one or more interactions, but limited to the same subject or object of the related interactions (e.g. a dwc:Occurrence or a dwc:Taxon)
data.examples: The mass of a fruit exposed to multiple visitors was 100 grams

data.label: Number Of Removed Pollen Grains
data.definition: The total number of pollen grains removed from the anther(s) of the visited flower(s)
data.comments: The pollen grains may have been removed by multiple floral visitors. The number should include pollen grains from all anthers of the flower(s)

data.label: Number Of Conspecific Pollen Grains
data.definition: The total number of conspecific pollen grains deposited on the stigma(s) of the visited flower(s)
data.comments: The pollen grains may have been deposited at the end of the flower(s) anthesis by multiple floral visitors

data.label: Number Of Heterospecific Pollen Grains
data.definition: The total number of heterospecific pollen grains deposited on a the stigma(s) of the visited flower(s)
data.comments: The pollen grains may have been deposited at the end of the flower(s) anthesis by multiple floral visitors

data.label: Number Of Fertilized Ovules
data.definition: The total number of fertilized ovules in the visited flower(s)
data.comments: The ovules may have been fertilized as a result of multiple floral visits

data.label: Number Of Pollen Tubes
data.definition: The total number of pollen tubes growing in the style(s) of the visited flower(s)
data.comments: The flower(s) may have been exposed by multiple floral visitors. The number should include pollen tubes growing from all styles of the flower(s)

data.label: Seed Mass In Miligrams
data.definition: The total mass in miligrams of the seeds of mature fruit(s)
data.comments: If reporting this value, the `seedSet` should also be provided.

data.label: Seed Set
data.definition: The total number of seeds of mature fruit(s)
data.comments: If reporting this value, the `fruitSet` should also be provided.

data.label: Fruit Mass In Grams
data.definition: The total mass in grams of the fruit(s)
data.comments: If reporting this value, the `fruitSet` should also be provided.

data.label: Fruit Set
data.definition: The total number of mature fruits of the exposed flower(s)
data.comments: If reporting this value, the `numberOfExposedFlowers` should also be provided

data.label: Number Of Exposed Flowers
data.definition: The total number of flowers exposed to floral visitors
data.comments: The exposed flowers are the flowers monitored to measure the reproductive success of the plant(s). For the total number of flowers available to floral visitors (including flowers unmonitored) use `flowerAbundance`.

data.label: Nectar Dynamics
data.definition: The measurements of nectar dynamics
data.comments: A nectar dynamics measurement is related to the plant occurrence(s)
data.examples: The accumulated nectar in the monitored flowers

data.label: Accumlated Nectar Volume In Microliters
data.definition: The total volume in microliters of nectar accumulated by the flower(s)
data.comments: The total volume of nectar should be provided for flowers which were not exposed to floral visitors during all their longevity. If reporting this value, the `accumulatedNectarHours` should also be provided.

data.label: Accumulated Nectar Concentration
data.definition: The concentration of the nectar, in percentage of sugar, accumulated by the flower(s)
data.comments: The accumulated nectar concentration should be provided for flowers which were not exposed to floral visitors during all their longevity. If reporting this value, the `accumulatedNectarHours` should also be provided

data.label: Accumulated Nectar Hours
data.definition: The time in hours in which the nectar was let to accumulated in the flower(s)

data.label: Accumulated Nectar Flowers
data.definition: The total number of flowers which the accumulated nectar measurements were made
data.comments: The flowers should be prevented from visitation (not exposed to floral visitors) during all their logenvity
